* can pick up weapons and food.

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | [EvilHack - monst.c, line 2895](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/master/src/monst.c#L2895)                                                                                                                            |

An **agent**, @, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). They are [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)") [minions](/wiki/Minion "Minion") that possess the ability to teleport randomly, and will also seek out the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") if it is left on the floor.

Agents possess a weapon attack and three claw attacks, which are all capable of stealing the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"), [The Idol of Moloch](/wiki/The_Idol_of_Moloch "The Idol of Moloch") or other [unique items](/wiki/Unique_item "Unique item").

Eating an agent [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 3⁄5 chance of conveying [teleportitis](/wiki/Teleportitis "Teleportitis").

## Generation

Agents only appear in [Infidel](/wiki/Infidel "Infidel") games, and are always generated hostile; their [monster difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") is deliberately lower than what their abilities suggest. Agents will not be randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), and are not valid forms for [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

An agent [generates with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a [potion of invisibility](/wiki/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility"), a 1⁄3 chance of [standard armor](/wiki/Leather_armor "Leather armor"), and either a [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword") (3⁄4 chance) or a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") (1⁄4 chance) as their weapon.

## Strategy

While not physically powerful, agents are an early-game nuisance for Infidels due to their ability to steal the Amulet and warp away. Their theft attack can also steal other items, ensuring they remain a nuisance well into the later stages of the game - of note is that it is possible to fool them into stealing a mundane, similar-looking [figurine](/wiki/Figurine "Figurine") rather than The Idol of Moloch.

## Encyclopedia entry

It was part of his profession to kill people. He had never liked  
doing it and when he had to kill he did it as well as he knew how  
and forgot about it. As a secret agent who held the rare double-O  
prefix -- the licence to kill in the Secret Service -- it was his  
duty to be as cool about death as a surgeon. If it happened,  
it happened. Regret was unprofessional -- worse, it was  
death-watch beetle in the soul.  
\[ Goldfinger, by Ian Fleming ]

From NetHackWiki

@ agent
Difficulty 6
Attacks Weapon 1d4 amulet-stealing, Claw 1d1 amulet-stealing, Claw 1d1 amulet-stealing, Claw 1d1 amulet-stealing
@ agent
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Weapon 1d4 amulet-stealing, Claw 1d1 amulet-stealing, Claw 1d1 amulet-stealing, Claw 1d1 amulet-stealing

Base level 6
Base experience 69
Speed 18
Base AC 10
Base MR 10
Alignment -7 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed causes teleportitis (60%)

A agent:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • can teleport.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 2895

An agent, @, is a type of monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. They are strong human minions that possess the ability to teleport randomly, and will also seek out the Amulet of Yendor if it is left on the floor.

Agents possess a weapon attack and three claw attacks, which are all capable of stealing the Amulet of Yendor, The Idol of Moloch or other unique items.

Eating an agent corpse or tin has a 3⁄5 chance of conveying teleportitis.

Generation

Agents only appear in Infidel games, and are always generated hostile; their monster difficulty is deliberately lower than what their abilities suggest. Agents will not be randomly generated in Gehennom, and are not valid forms for polymorph.

An agent generates with a potion of invisibility, a 1⁄3 chance of standard armor, and either a short sword (3⁄4 chance) or a dagger (1⁄4 chance) as their weapon.

Strategy

While not physically powerful, agents are an early-game nuisance for Infidels due to their ability to steal the Amulet and warp away. Their theft attack can also steal other items, ensuring they remain a nuisance well into the later stages of the game - of note is that it is possible to fool them into stealing a mundane, similar-looking figurine rather than The Idol of Moloch.

Encyclopedia entry

It was part of his profession to kill people. He had never liked
doing it and when he had to kill he did it as well as he knew how
and forgot about it. As a secret agent who held the rare double-O
prefix -- the licence to kill in the Secret Service -- it was his
duty to be as cool about death as a surgeon. If it happened,
it happened. Regret was unprofessional -- worse, it was
death-watch beetle in the soul.
[ Goldfinger, by Ian Fleming ]

An '''agent''', {{black|@}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. They are [[strong]] [[Human (monster attribute)|human]] [[minion]]s that possess the ability to teleport randomly, and will also seek out the [[Amulet of Yendor]] if it is left on the floor.

Agents possess a weapon attack and three claw attacks, which are all capable of stealing the [[Amulet of Yendor]], [[The Idol of Moloch]] or other [[unique item]]s.

Eating an agent [[corpse]] or [[tin]] has a {{frac|3|5}} chance of conveying [[teleportitis]].

==Generation==
Agents only appear in [[Infidel]] games, and are always generated hostile; their [[monster difficulty]] is deliberately lower than what their abilities suggest. Agents will not be randomly generated in [[Gehennom]], and are not valid forms for [[polymorph]].

An agent [[Monster starting inventory|generates with]] a [[potion of invisibility]], a {{frac|3}} chance of [[Leather armor|standard armor]], and either a [[short sword]] ({{frac|3|4}} chance) or a [[dagger]] ({{frac|4}} chance) as their weapon.

==Strategy==
While not physically powerful, agents are an early-game nuisance for Infidels due to their ability to steal the Amulet and warp away. Their theft attack can also steal other items, ensuring they remain a nuisance well into the later stages of the game - of note is that it is possible to fool them into stealing a mundane, similar-looking [[figurine]] rather than The Idol of Moloch.
